answers.answer: Hyperkalemia: rule out Addison's disease (adrenal cortical nsufficiency), dehydration, cardiac arrhythmia, severe renal disease, hyperkalemic acidosis, diabetic acidosis, hypoarenalism, metabolic acidosis (like in diabetes mellitus).

question: I have read posts about low potassium levels but does anyone know about high potassium levels and lupus? My husband had a level 8 and had to go to the emergency room. He is fine now but we got a scare. He was diagnosed with lupus a few months after he went into septic shock.
title: Hyperkalemia. High potassium
